job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for a QA Engineer for one of our Java-based teams who's proficient in testing enterprise-scale software, ready to learn and grow, and interested in facing and overcoming technical challenges. You will work as part of a distributed agile team developing and testing the RWS software. The fast-paced agile development cycle will require you to use several testing approaches, design and write test automation code as well as executing manual testing. You will be a part of a product team that consists of highly skilled and experienced Java developers and QA engineers and work closely with them to deliver high-quality and innovative software.

   Our teams build scalable Java microservices based on Spring, JPA 2.0, OpenSearch, GraphQL, OpenAPI RESTful web service and more to support our Tridion Content Management products. These microservices are provided to customers on-premise and supported in the cloud using Docker-based AWS container services. Our services run on popular RDBMS' and OpenSearch.

   Our Content Management software runs at customers serving millions of page views per day served by hundreds of servers. Our customers include many big-name brands. So, you can imagine the technological challenges we face in order to provide a scalable architecture that not only does what customers want, but also performs well. We did a pretty good job so far: we are a leader in the Structured content management area. But to stay on top, we are looking to expand with talented QA Engineer to help define and drive technical initiatives to keep the platform current and more efficient., * Create test plans based on Risk-based testing technique
     * Define the required QA coverage for the stories in the team Grooming and Planning meetings
     * Execute automated and manual tests in accordance with the test plan
     * Configure environments for testing purposes
     * Co-ordinate with the developers, reproduce issues when required, and steer the defect through its lifecycle
     * Define the scope of regression testing for every release using a Risk-based approach
     * Design and create automated test cases in the Java automation suite
     * Seek out and identify opportunities for test automation
     * Design and monitor nightly runs of automated tests
     * Design and execute performance tests
     * Analyze performance test results and provide comprehensible results
job_details.full_text:
QA Engineer

We are looking for a QA Engineer for one of our Java-based teams who's proficient in testing enterprise-scale software, ready to learn and grow, and interested in facing and overcoming technical challenges. You will work as part of a distributed agile team developing and testing the RWS software. The fast-paced agile development cycle will require you to use several testing approaches, design and write test automation code as well as executing manual testing. You will be a part of a product team that consists of highly skilled and experienced Java developers and QA engineers and work closely with them to deliver high-quality and innovative software.

   Our teams build scalable Java microservices based on Spring, JPA 2.0, OpenSearch, GraphQL, OpenAPI RESTful web service and more to support our Tridion Content Management products. These microservices are provided to customers on-premise and supported in the cloud using Docker-based AWS container services. Our services run on popular RDBMS' and OpenSearch.

   Our Content Management software runs at customers serving millions of page views per day served by hundreds of servers. Our customers include many big-name brands. So, you can imagine the technological challenges we face in order to provide a scalable architecture that not only does what customers want, but also performs well. We did a pretty good job so far: we are a leader in the Structured content management area. But to stay on top, we are looking to expand with talented QA Engineer to help define and drive technical initiatives to keep the platform current and more efficient., * Create test plans based on Risk-based testing technique
     * Define the required QA coverage for the stories in the team Grooming and Planning meetings
     * Execute automated and manual tests in accordance with the test plan
     * Configure environments for testing purposes
     * Co-ordinate with the developers, reproduce issues when required, and steer the defect through its lifecycle
     * Define the scope of regression testing for every release using a Risk-based approach
     * Design and create automated test cases in the Java automation suite
     * Seek out and identify opportunities for test automation
     * Design and monitor nightly runs of automated tests
     * Design and execute performance tests
     * Analyze performance test results and provide comprehensible results

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on traditional QA engineering for Java-based enterprise software, with no mention of AI, machine learning, or generative models. The tasks and technologies described are standard for a QA role and do not align with any of the AI-specific profiles.

phrases.phrase: align technical solutions with strategic goals
phrases.justification: This phrase directly relates to understanding the business context and ensuring technical work supports broader objectives.

phrases.phrase: translate business needs into technical requirements
phrases.justification: This highlights the ability to bridge the gap between business objectives and technical implementation.

phrases.phrase: product team that consists of highly skilled and experienced Java developers and QA engineers and work closely with them to deliver high-quality and innovative software
phrases.justification: Implies understanding the product goals and collaborating to achieve them.

phrases.phrase: help define and drive technical initiatives to keep the platform current and more efficient
phrases.justification: Suggests understanding the business need for platform improvement and driving initiatives.

phrases.phrase: design and write test automation code
phrases.justification: This involves writing code, a core aspect of software development, specifically for testing purposes.

phrases.phrase: Create test plans based on Risk-based testing technique
phrases.justification: While planning, the creation of test plans involves defining how software will be tested, which is a development-adjacent activity.

phrases.phrase: Define the required QA coverage for the stories in the team Grooming and Planning meetings
phrases.justification: Involves defining testing strategies which are part of the software development lifecycle.

phrases.phrase: Design and create automated test cases in the Java automation suite
phrases.justification: Directly involves designing and creating code for automated testing.

phrases.phrase: Seek out and identify opportunities for test automation
phrases.justification: Proactively looking for ways to improve the software development process through automation.

phrases.phrase: Design and monitor nightly runs of automated tests
phrases.justification: Involves designing and managing automated testing processes.

phrases.phrase: Design and execute performance tests
phrases.justification: Designing and executing tests to evaluate software performance is a development-related task.

phrases.phrase: Configure environments for testing purposes
phrases.justification: Setting up and managing testing environments is a key part of operations engineering.

phrases.phrase: Co-ordinate with the developers, reproduce issues when required, and steer the defect through its lifecycle
phrases.justification: Involves managing the lifecycle of defects, which is an operational aspect of software development.

phrases.phrase: These microservices are provided to customers on-premise and supported in the cloud using Docker-based AWS container services.
phrases.justification: Indicates experience with deployment and support in cloud environments, which aligns with operations.

phrases.phrase: Our services run on popular RDBMS' and OpenSearch.
phrases.justification: Understanding and testing against production infrastructure components.
